header_summary:
Javier Mateos et al. discuss the successful enhancement of BIP-85 derivation across various codex32 tools, highlighting a unified approach and technical robustness in the Bitcoin Development community's efforts to improve and assess changes collaboratively. This development, including extensive testing and a reference implementation, signifies a stride toward uniformity and efficiency in tool application, underlining the community's dedication to rigorous evaluation ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/774faeb9-6c6b-4545-8071-56ec03e78cd0n@googlegroups.com/T/#m8c510f0d857a6cb468aa3e941aa817475e7119d4)).

Jeremy points out an opportunity within Bitcoin's cryptographic operations, suggesting the inclusion of raw field arithmetic opcodes to enhance efficiency and functionality. This proposal aims to formalize and optimize operations that the current elliptical curve (EC) point multiplication opcodes inadvertently permit, advocating for a system that directly supports and streamlines these underlying arithmetic capabilities, which could profoundly impact Bitcoin's cryptographic framework ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CAO3Pvs-Cwj=5vJgBfDqZGtvmoYPMrpKYFAYHRb_EqJ5i0PG0cA@mail.gmail.com/T/#mca83b38959201b543e13a3eb599add135feed0b8)).

Fanquake announces the release of Bitcoin Core version v29.1rc2 binaries, emphasizing the importance of community feedback in the pre-release phase to enhance the software's reliability and efficiency. This step in the development cycle, supported by accessible binaries and source code for testing, reflects the iterative and collaborative nature of open-source software development, vital for refining Bitcoin Core ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/6354339d-9348-44d0-b531-a9abd88626c1n@googlegroups.com/T/#u#m10f15727bed1b3a9f2c877e01d0e5f147be5d50d)).

Bruno's exploration into "Bitcoinfuzz" showcases an evolving experimental project focused on enhancing security through differential fuzzing of Bitcoin and Lightning Network protocols. With over 35 bugs identified in key projects, the venture's commitment to rigorous testing extends to a diverse range of programming languages and implementations, underlining the critical role of community-driven efforts in advancing the ecosystem's safety and robustness ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/the-state-of-bitcoinfuzz/1946)).

recent_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Add BIP-0093 (Codex32) as application to BIP-0085
recent_posts.summary:
- The recent communication highlights successful BIP-85 modifications across various codex32 tools.
- The updates address prior concerns and promote uniform application in differing tools.
- This showcases a collaborative effort in the Bitcoin Development community for enhancement.

recent_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Elliptic Curve Operations for Bitcoin Script
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses Bitcoin's cryptographic functionality, highlighting unintended capabilities in EC point multiplication.
- It proposes including raw field arithmetic opcodes to enhance efficiency and performance.
- This expansion aims to address the needs of Bitcoin development, ensuring its robustness and versatility.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 29.1 release candidate 2 available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core v29.1rc2 binaries and source code are now available online.
- This release candidate invites community testing and feedback before its official launch.
- The development mailing list communication highlights open-source collaboration efforts.

recent_posts.title: Delving Simplicity Part Ⅲ: Building Data Types
recent_posts.summary:
- Simplicity is explored for its potential in crafting complex computations and handling logical operations.
- It advances in digital logic and cryptographic functions, assuring correctness through formal verification.
- The language evolves to support secure, efficient blockchain applications, emphasizing adaptability and optimization.

recent_posts.title: The state of bitcoinfuzz
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoinfuzz aims to enhance Bitcoin and Lightning Network security through differential fuzzing.
- It has identified over 35 bugs in significant projects by fuzzing various protocol implementations.
- Future plans include expanding fuzzing capabilities and integrating with Google's OSS-Fuzz for improved testing.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Add BIP-0093 (Codex32) as application to BIP-0085
active_posts.summary:
- Ben Westgate proposes integrating BIP-93 with BIP-85 for better wallet backup solutions.
- Codex32 implements human-readable formats and secret sharing, enhancing BIP-32 seed backups.
- There's ongoing support for codex32, with a draft PR for Bitcoin Core and community feedback welcomed.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Elliptic Curve Operations for Bitcoin Script
active_posts.summary:
- A proposal introduces Elliptic Curve operation op codes to enhance Bitcoin scripting capabilities.
- The initiative seeks to allow the computation of Taproot output public keys, enabling more dynamic smart contracts on Bitcoin.
- The proposal includes adding four specific op codes for diverse applications, with technical details available for community feedback.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 29.1 release candidate 2 available
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core v29.1rc2 binaries and source code are now available.
- This release candidate aids testing, critical for the software's development cycle.
- Feedback from the Bitcoin Development Mailing List subscribers is crucial for improvement.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin and Quantum Computing
active_posts.summary:
- The collaboration has produced a report on quantum computing's impact on Bitcoin.
- It suggests solutions for Bitcoin's quantum computing challenges and security risks.
- The report stresses the importance of community engagement and proactive measures.

active_posts.title: Confidential Script: Emulate soft forks using stateless TEEs
active_posts.summary:
- The "confidential-script-lib" library supports confidential, advanced Bitcoin script execution.
- It uses AWS's Nitro Enclave and KMS for high security and minimal trust.
- The library allows testing of unadopted features and soft fork upgrades.

active_posts.title: A Game-Theoretic Approach to Bitcoin’s Valuation in Equilibrium
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin's unique features and finite supply make it a candidate for stabilizing the economy.
- The concept prioritizes Bitcoin as a constant, universal unit of account, aiming for macroeconomic stability.
- Despite adoption challenges, Bitcoin's game-theoretic value promises a future of greater economic stability.

today_in_history_posts.title: Overhauled BIP151
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Significant updates proposed for BIP151 include new key exchange and encryption enhancements.
- The author debates issuing a new BIP number or altering the current BIP151 specification.
- Key changes involve a 32-byte key exchange, NODE_ENCRYPTED bit, and short-command IDs to lower bandwidth.

today_in_history_posts.title: Both-side funded channels
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Cezary was informed by Christian Decker about implementing both-side funding channels.
- The plan allows trustless transactions by merging funds into one channel.
- Cezary sought to clarify his understanding and inquired about the implementation timeline.

today_in_history_posts.title: Hardcoded seeds, DNS seeds and Darknet nodes
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The study shows how darknet nodes connect to Bitcoin, highlighting the importance of updated seed data.
- IPv4 nodes face decreasing connectivity, whereas I2P nodes maintain longer connections, showing network disparities.
- A new darknet seeder aims to enhance Bitcoin network integration, with community involvement critical for success.
